meanings.definition: To hesitate or be unwilling to proceed.
meanings.sent1: She always bauks before making a decision.
meanings.sent2: Don't bauk when it comes to trying new things.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to bauk at the sight of the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: His fear of failure made him bauk at taking risks.
meanings.sent5: The child's shyness caused her to bauk at speaking in front of the class.

meanings.definition: A ridge or bank of earth.
meanings.sent1: The farmer walked along the bauk to inspect the crops.
meanings.sent2: The river had eroded the bauk over time.
meanings.sent3: The ants built their nest at the base of the bauk.
meanings.sent4: The bauk provided a natural barrier against the wind.
meanings.sent5: The children loved rolling down the grassy bauk in the park.

meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a sturdy bauk to support the structure.
meanings.sent2: The old barn had a bauk running across the ceiling.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the bauk was a balance beam in their game.
meanings.sent4: The bauk creaked under the weight of the heavy load.
meanings.sent5: The bauk was polished to a smooth finish for the new furniture.
